title: Are the Batteries Lasting Long Enough?
question_text:
The Durabell Battery company was concerned about the life of its EE battery. In the past, the EE battery had a mean life span of $34$ hours, but the company was concerned that the battery life had decreased. It took a random sample of $40$ batteries from its assembly plant and tested them. The mean life span was $33.4$ hours with a standard deviation of $2.4$ hours.
Using a significance level of $\alpha=0.05$, which of the following is an appropriate conclusion of a one-sample $t$-test for the population mean of the EE battery?

choices.text: Clearly, the new mean battery life has decreased from $34$ to $33.4$ hours. Thus, we can reject the null hypothesis and show that the EE battery life has decreased.
